items.name: Advanced Fishing Trap
items.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Trap. Though a Lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching a rarer type of fish. To attach a lure to the Advanced Fishing Trap, inspect the trap by pressing 'F' and drag the lure into the dedicated lure slot.

items.name: Basic Dried Meat
items.description: Basic Dried Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Basic Fishing Rod
items.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Rod. Though a lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching fish of a certain rarity or increase the size of the capture area. For a list of available lures, view this page .

items.name: Basic Fishing Trap
items.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Trap. Though a Lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching a rarer type of fish. To attach a lure to the Basic Fishing Trap, inspect the trap by pressing 'F' and drag the lure into the dedicated lure slot.

items.name: Berry & Seed Bar
items.description: Full of energy for long hikes, long lasting effects and easily crafted.

items.name: Berry Farming Packet
items.description: The Berry Farming Packet is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Berry seeds, which then can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop plots to grow Plant Resources .

items.name: Berry Jam
items.description: Berry Jam is a long-lasting Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Berry Jam, Strawberry Jam and Pickled Carrot , does not spoil and is therefore a valuable food for long-term storage.

items.name: Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet
items.description: Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Bread
items.description: Bread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Bread Dough
items.description: Bread Dough is the precursor to the mid/late-game Food Bread . Bread Dough will eventually decay, but can be preserved in an Ice Box , Refrigerator , or Deep Freeze .

items.name: Caramel Berry Tart
items.description: Caramel Berry Tart is late-game Food that when consumed provides a considerable boost to stamina, speed, resistance to cave sickness and a chance to mine additional stone.

items.name: Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat
items.description: Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Bacon
items.description: Cooked Bacon is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Fatty T-Bone
items.description: Cooked Fatty T-Bone is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Gamey Meat
items.description: Cooked Gamey Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Giant Steak
items.description: Cooked Giant Steak is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Meat
items.description: Cooked Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Soft Meat
items.description: Cooked Soft Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked Stringy Meat
items.description: Cooked Stringy Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Cooked White Meat
items.description: Cooked White Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Dried Gamey Meat
items.description: Dried Gamey Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Dried Soft Meat
items.description: Dried Soft Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Dried Stringy Meat
items.description: Dried Stringy Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Dried White Meat
items.description: Dried White Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Electronic Food Trough
items.description: All Food Troughs have an allow list for nearby animals that can be accessed by pressing 'X'. To change which animals can eat from a specific food trough, select the animals permitted to eat from the food trough and select "Allowlist-Only Interaction". By default, all nearby animals can eat from food troughs.

items.name: Fish Chunk Stew
items.description: Fish Chunk Stew is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Fish Chunks
items.description: Fish Chunks are added to the Prospector's inventory after looting the carcass of a fish. Fish caught using a Fishing Trap or Fishing Rod can be converted into Fish Chunks as well. Fish Chunks can be cooked in a Campfire , or used in other dishes such as Freshwater Fillet Curry or Crumbed Saltwater Fillet . Right-click a Freshwater/Saltwater fish to convert it into Fish Chunks .

items.name: Fish Pie
items.description: Fish Pie is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Fish Trophy Mount
items.description: The Fish Trophy Mount can be used to display impressive catches with details of the quality, weight, and length of the fish shown. When holding down R, Prospectors can choose between 3 different variants. Fish stored in the Fish Trophy Mount will not spoil. All Fish obtained using a Fishing Rod or Fishing Trap can be placed in the Fish Trophy Mount.

items.name: Fisher's Module
items.description: This module increases the user's ability to catch Unique Fish and, somehow, increases the quality of caught fish. It can be researched and crafted on the Space Station in the Workshop . Multiple Fisher's Modules may be equipped if the Prospector has available slots on their Envirosuit, which will further increasing the user's ability to fish and become the Master Angler they wish to be.

items.name: Flatbread
items.description: Flatbread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Flatbread Dough
items.description: Flatbread Dough is the precursor to the mid/late-game Food Flatbread . Flatbread Dough will eventually decay, but can be preserved in an Ice Box , Refrigerator , or Deep Freeze .

items.name: Food Consumption Paste
items.description: In-game description: An organic confection that arrests hunger for a limited time. In-game flavor text: Just because it's organic, doesn't mean it's good for you.

items.name: Food Trough
items.description: The Food Trough is a basic trough used to feed Mounts / Pets and is recommended if prospectors wish to idly tame a juvenile. Food Troughs benefit from the Extra Space I / Extra Space II talent.

items.name: Freshwater Fish Fillet
items.description: Freshwater Fish Fillet is is the result of filleting a Freshwater Fish at a Basic Fishing Bench . While eating Freshwater Fish Fillet will replenish a small amount of Hunger , there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook before eating.

items.name: Fried Fish Chunks
items.description: Fried Fish Chunks is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Glass Food Trough
items.description: The Glass Food Trough is a decorative upgrade to the Food Trough and allows multiple creatures to eat from it simultaneously, similar to the Large Food Trough . Glass Food Troughs benefit from the Extra Space I / Extra Space II talent.

items.name: Gorse Smoked Gamey Meat
items.description: Gorse Smoked Gamey Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Large Food Trough
items.description: The Large Food Trough is a slight upgrade to the Food Trough that allows for multiple creatures to eat from it simultaneously. Large Food Troughs benefit from the Extra Space I / Extra Space II talent.

items.name: Meat Pie
items.description: Meat Pie is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Metal Food Trough
items.description: The Metal Food Trough is a decorative upgrade to the Food Trough and allows multiple creatures to eat from it simultaneously, similar to the Large Food Trough . Metal Food Troughs benefit from the Extra Space I / Extra Space II talent.

items.name: Mixed Berries
items.description: Mixed Berries is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Mushroom Soup
items.description: Mushroom Soup is a Food that satisfies Hunger . It provides the unique Status Effect , Mushroom Soup , which increases maximum Health and improves Stamina regeneration.

items.name: Potato Bread
items.description: Potato Bread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Prime Meat Attachment
items.description: Prime Meat Attachment is a mid-to-end game item available once the prospector has unlocked the Tool Attachment Pack tech.

items.name: Pumpkin Bread
items.description: Pumpkin Bread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Raw Bacon
items.description: Raw Bacon is an uncooked prime meat obtained by skinning Wild Boar with a Knife .
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw Chicken
items.description: Raw Chicken can be obtained from the carcass of a once cryogenically frozen Chicken that can be purchased from the Workshop .

items.name: Raw Copper Lamp
items.description: The Raw Copper Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

items.name: Raw Fatty T-Bone
items.description: Raw Fatty T-Bone is a prime cut of raw meat that drops from various hostile Fauna . Eating Raw Fatty T-Bone will replenish Health , but there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw Gamey Meat
items.description: Raw Gamey Meat is a prime cut of raw meat that drops from various Fauna . Eating Raw Gamey Meat will replenish Health , but there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw Giant Steak
items.description: Raw Giant Steak is a prime cut of raw meat that drops from various large Fauna . Eating Raw Giant Steak will replenish Health , but there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw Gold Lamp
items.description: The Raw Gold Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

items.name: Raw Meat
items.description: Raw Meat can be obtained by skinning animals with a Knife . While eating Raw Meat will replenish Health there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook before eating.

items.name: Raw Oxite Lamp
items.description: The Raw Oxite Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

items.name: Raw Soft Meat
items.description: Raw Soft Meat can be obtained by Skinning animals with a Knife . Eating Raw Soft Meat will replenish Health there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw Stringy Meat
items.description: Raw Stringy Meat is a prime cut of raw meat that drops from various Fauna . Eating Raw Stringy Meat will replenish Health , but there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Raw White Meat
items.description: Raw White Meat is a prime cut of raw meat that drops from various Fauna . Eating Raw White Meat will replenish Health , but there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook first before eating.
items.crafted_at: the Butchery Bench using Raw Meat

items.name: Refined Wood Fishing Rod
items.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Rod. Though a lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching fish of a certain rarity or increase the size of the capture area. For a list of available lures, view this page .

items.name: Rhubarb Stew
items.description: Rhubarb Stew is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Rotten Meat Lure
items.description: The Rotten Meat Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like all Lures , the Rotten Meat Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

items.name: Rustic Food Trough
items.description: The Rustic Food Trough is a decorative upgrade to the Food Trough and allows multiple creatures to eat from it simultaneously, similar to the Large Food Trough . Rustic Food Troughs benefit from the Extra Space I / Extra Space II talent.

items.name: Saltwater Fish Fillet
items.description: Saltwater Fish Fillet is is the result of filleting a Saltwater Fish at a Basic Fishing Bench . While eating Saltwater Fish Fillet will replenish a small amount of Hunger , there is a possibility of negative Status Effects when doing so. It is better to Cook before eating.

items.name: Seed Bread
items.description: Seed Bread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Spoiled Meat
items.description: Spoiled Meat is a byproduct of Raw Meat that has been allowed to go rancid. Can be used to make a variety of items, primarily Poison Paste . Requires the You Gonna Eat That? talent for Spoiled Meat to become consumable.

items.name: Stew
items.description: Stew is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Strawberries & Cream
items.description: Strawberries & Cream is a long-lasting Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs.

items.name: Strawberry
items.description: Strawberry is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Strawberry Farming Packet
items.description: The Strawberry Farming Packet is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Strawberry seeds, which then can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop plots to grow Plant Resources .

items.name: Strawberry Hard Candy
items.description: Strawberry Hard Candy is a consumable food that provides a quick boost of movement speed.

items.name: Strawberry Jam
items.description: Strawberry Jam is a long-lasting Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Strawberry Jam, Berry Jam and Pickled Carrot , do not spoil and is therefore a valuable food for long-term storage.

items.name: Sweetcorn Soup
items.description: Sweetcorn Soup is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

items.name: Tomato Soup
items.description: Tomato Soup is a consumable Food crafted from Tomatoes and Water . As Tomatoes are only found on Prometheus , this recipe requires the New Frontiers DLC to obtain the ingredients.

items.name: Volatile Raw Exotics
items.description: While the Exotics prospectors found on Olympus and Styx were originally believed to be the only known variation, the UDA has made a remarkable discovery. This unstable variant is different and appears to have an impact on the local flora not seen before.

items.name: Wild Berry
items.description: Wild Berry are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish both Hunger and Thirst .

items.name: Wooden Fishing Rod
items.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Rod. Though a lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching fish of a certain rarity or increase the size of the capture area. For a list of available lures, view this page .
